eu.fbk.dkm.springles.backend

Class AbstractSailBackend

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.fbk.dkm.springles.backend.AbstractSailBackend
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Backend

    public abstract class AbstractSailBackend
extends Object
implements Backend
    Abstract backend implementation wrapping a Sail instance.

    This class provides a base implementation of the Backend interface that wraps an underlying Sail instance and provides access to its data through SailTransactions. Concrete classes must implement method initializeSail(File) that is called at initialization time and returns the sail object actually wrapped. Thread safety is realized through mutually exclusive synchronization of methods accessing the wrapped sail. Note that no check is performed to ensure that invocation of API methods conforms to the prescribed lifecycle: if required, such a check can be obtained by wrapping the backend with Backends.debuggingBackend(Backend, Logger).

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(@Nullable
              File dataDir)
                throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Initializes the backend. This method is called to initialize the backend, supplying the data directory where the backend can store its data. The method acquires the wrapped sail object by calling initializeSail(File), then initializes the sail and caches its writable and ValueFactory properties.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface Backend
        Parameters:
        dataDir - an optional data directory where the backend can persist its RDF data
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure

      • initializeSail

        protected abstract org.openrdf.sail.Sail initializeSail(@Nullable
                                   File dataDir)
                                                 throws org.openrdf.sail.SailException,
                                                        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Acquires and initializes the wrapped sail, based on the supplied optional data directory. This method is called by initialize(File) and must return the wrapped sail instance, non-initialized.
        Parameters:
        dataDir - the data directory, possibly null for transient backends
        Returns:
        a non-initialized sail instance
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.sail.SailException - on failure (will be wrapped and propagated by initialize(File)
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure

      • getSail

        protected final org.openrdf.sail.Sail getSail()
        Provides access to the wrapped sail object. This method can be called only after initialization of the backend.
        Returns:
        the wrapped sail object

      • isWritable

        public boolean isWritable()
        Specifies whether the backend supports write access (delete / add statements). This method is called only after the backend is initialized, as the writable status may depend on the data directory supplied at initialization time. Returns the writable status of the wrapped sail object.
        Specified by:
        isWritable in interface Backend
        Returns:
        true if the backend supports write access

      • getValueFactory

        public org.openrdf.model.ValueFactory getValueFactory()
        Returns the ValueFactory associated to the backend. This method is called only after the backend is initialized. Returns the ValueFactory associated to the wrapped sail object.
        Specified by:
        getValueFactory in interface Backend
        Returns:
        the ValueFactory associated to the backend

      • newTransaction

        public Transaction newTransaction(String id,
                         boolean writable)
                           throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Creates a new transaction manipulating data in the backend. The returned transaction is not expected to support inference (InferenceMode parameters and closure-related operations are ignored) as well as named queries and update operations (methods Transaction.query(URI, QueryType, InferenceMode, Object...) and Transaction.update(URI, InferenceMode, Object...) are unsupported). Creates a SailTransaction, backed by a SailConnection to the wrapped sail. In case a Bigdata sail is wrapped, the method opens a suitable read-only or read/write connection to the Bigdata sail, based on the supplied writable parameter.
        Specified by:
        newTransaction in interface Backend
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the created transaction
        writable - true if the transaction must support read/write access
        Returns:
        the created transaction
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure, including the case a read/write transaction is requested but the backend is read-only

      • close

        public void close()
           throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Closes the backend. This method is called to close the backend and release the associated resources. For some Backend implementations, properly closing the backend is mandatory in order to avoid data losses (see specific implementation details). Closes the wrapped sail.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Backend
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException - on failure

      • getBigdataConnection

        private static org.openrdf.sail.SailConnection getBigdataConnection(org.openrdf.sail.Sail sail,
                                                   boolean writable)
                                                             throws org.openrdf.sail.SailException
        Helper method that opens the appropriate Bigdata connection based on the specified writable parameter.
        Parameters:
        sail - the Bigdata sail
        writable - the desired writable status for the connection
        Returns:
        the opened connection, on success
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.sail.SailException - on failure
